OOC:

Having just crashed I'd say no, no beast forms yet. Once the energon levels
are detected though BEast forms will become a must ;)

----- Original Message -----
From: "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, March 09, 2002 11:54 AM
Subject: Re: Dawn on a New Beast Wars


> OOC: Have they taken Beast Modes yet.  I know Sunhawk hasn't, but I
> don't know about everyone else.
>
> BIC:  Sunhawk:  SIR YES SIR!
>
> He took his weapons back and began looking for something to repair
> until he got some action.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > > Sunhawk: You do realize most of this stuff was obsolete 6 months
> ago
> > > don't you?
> > >
> >
> > {Talos}
> > Bridge
> >
> >     Talos examined the console as the first flickers of life
> returned to the
> > rewired system, alot of the starboard autoguns had been damaged if
> not
> > utterly destroyed in the harsh landing, the port side auto guns
> number at
> > best two with a third that seemed to be offline.
> >
> >     From a defensive stand point the ship could hold off a few
> attackers for
> > a few minutes but he didn't dare assume Megatron would send one or
> two of
> > the scum at them, no Megatron would send all his followeres to get
> the job
> > done, bullies always were alot braver when they held strength in
> numbers.
> > Shaking his head he rose walking past the other bots still working
> stopping
> > a moment to listen to Sunhawks words, "We'll see, as far as things
> go
> > Sunhawk you're on a clean slate with me, step out of line and
> you'll get
> > your wish of a stay in the brig but I don't see that happening any
> time
> > soon."
> >
> >     Walking on he moved deeper into the ship holding onto a wall as
> the hall
> > was tilted, it hadn't been a level crash either, they must have
> struck
> > something or simply the ground torn by the ships force had created
> something
> > to bank it's course. In any case he moved on checking on the
> damages as he
> > went and looking for any other bots that might have missed the call
> in...
